# Step 1: Create an aov object

               data = data)

Model fitting
‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏£‡∏î‡∏≤function ‡∏ï‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á ‡πÜ ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏°‡∏µ‡πÉ‡∏´‡πâ‡πÄ‡∏•‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏Å‡πÉ‡∏ô epifitter ‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏¥‡πà‡∏°‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏ô‡∏î‡πâ‡∏ß‡∏¢ ‡∏ï‡∏±‡∏ß‡πÄ‡∏•‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏á‡πà‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏î ‡∏ã‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á‡∏û‡∏≠‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ö‡πÅ‡∏ö‡∏ö‡∏à‡∏≥‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏î ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á ‡πÜ ‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏¢‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ‡∏ß‡∏¥‡∏ò‡∏µ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ñ‡∏î‡∏ñ‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏¥‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏™‡πâ‡∏ô ‡∏™‡∏≥‡∏´‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏™‡∏¥‡πà‡∏á‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ fit_lin() ‡∏ã‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á ‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£: ‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏•‡∏≤ (t) ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏£‡∏∏‡∏ô‡πÅ‡∏£‡∏á‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏Ñ‡∏´‡∏£‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡πÄ‡∏Å‡∏¥‡∏î‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏Ñ (y)

Multiple model fitting
‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ fit_multi() ‡∏ã‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á ‡∏à‡∏∞‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏ó‡∏≥‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô long format dataframe ‡∏Å‡πà‡∏≠‡∏ô ‡∏î‡∏±‡∏á‡∏ô‡∏±‡πâ‡∏ô ‡∏à‡∏∞‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏π‡∏•‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏¥‡∏°

fit_multi() ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ö‡∏∞ time_col ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏•‡∏±‡∏°‡∏ô‡πå‡πÑ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏Ñ‡∏∑‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏•‡∏≤ intensity_col‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏•‡∏±‡∏°‡∏ô‡πå‡πÑ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏Ñ‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏Ñ‡πà‡∏≤‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏¥‡∏ô‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏Ñ ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞ strata_cols ‡∏Ñ‡∏∑‡∏≠ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏•‡∏±‡∏°‡∏ô‡πå‡πÑ‡∏´‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô treatment

  data = pepper2,
  time_col = "time",

  nlin = FALSE
)

  labs(
    x = "Time",
    y = "r"
  )
p2 <- epi_all$Parameters %>%
  filter(model == "Logistic") %>%
  ggplot(aes(treat, 1 - exp(-y0))) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = y0_ci_lwr, ymax = y0_ci_upr),
    width = 0,
    size = 1
  ) +
  labs(
    x = "Time",
    y = "y0"
  )

p1 | p2

title: resources
text: It‚Äôs finally time for an upgraded notebook! I‚Äôve been Slacking myself (and subsequently burying) links to resources for far too long, so my favorites will now live here.

title: resources
text:
Screwdriver wrench r tools

free icons from fontawesome + the {fontawesome} R package for infusing your slides, website, RMarkdowns/Quarto Markdowns, and more with an extra splash of fun

title: resources
text:
Bar Chart data viz

from Data to Viz, a choose-your-adventure-type experience for creating your best data visualizations
The Sessions College Color Calculator, for creating color palettes

title: resources
text:
Desktop reporting & presentations

Quarto is all the rage these days (and by these days, I mean post-March 2022). Download and find some great tutorials here to get started
Meet xaringan: Making slides in R Markdown, by Allison Hill
Sharing Your xaringan Slides, by Garrick Aden-Buie

title: resources
text:
Book Open learning materials

Ever feel like you need a pick-me-up while learning stats or a new R tool? Look no further than Allison Horst‚Äôs Data Science Illustrations, featuring the cutest and most educational fuzzy monsters you‚Äôll ever see!
Mastering Shiny, by Hadley Wickham
Happy Git and GitHub for the useR, by Jenny Bryan
R for Data Science, by Hadley Wickham
W3Schools, particularly for their HTML & CSS tutorials

title: resources
text:
Users data science communities
While these groups are primarily based in SoCal/Santa Barbara, there are tons of awesome groups like these all over the world. Google around to see what‚Äôs near you!

R-Ladies Santa Barbara and R-Ladies Global, which work to promote gender diversity in the R community
EcoDataScience, an environmental data science study group at UCSB

Southern California R Users, an alliance of R user groups in Southern California

Santa Barbara Women in STEM, while not specifically data science-focused, this group holds some really great career and networking events, panels, flash talks, and more

title: resources
text:
Window Maximize web accessibility

The A11Y Project is a community-driven effort to make digital content more accessible. I still have a long way to go in making my own website WCAG compliant ‚Äì the A11Y Project not only has a ton of great blog posts, but also WCAG compliance checklist that I will definitely be returning to over and over again.
Coblis, a color blindness simulator ‚Äì just upload a file and view your color palettes as they would appear under different types of color deficiencies
